body:
Comment 3: 
I don't believe mingw changes anything.
This makefile is running the host gcc to produce a host binary.
You find out what kind of host by running uname.
Let's say uname is Linux.  No matter what file you compile, you're
not going to end up with a binary that can debug a Windows program,
because it's a Linux binary and won't run on Windows.

I imagine that if you're running under cygwin to do the build,
uname will be cygwin and someone will write the appropriate
code to do debugging on cygwin.  In that case uname is still
the right choice.
